title: Increment

items.title: Reframing tech debt
items.summary: If we bake addressing tech debt into our plans, could it become an opportunity to build abundance into our systems?
items.content_html: If we bake addressing tech debt into our plans, could it become an opportunity to build abundance into our systems?
items.content_text: If we bake addressing tech debt into our plans, could it become an opportunity to build abundance into our systems?

items.title: Planning for momentum
items.summary: On reimagining planning as a dynamic and generative process.
items.content_html: On reimagining planning as a dynamic and generative process.
items.content_text: On reimagining planning as a dynamic and generative process.

items.title: Planning in the dark
items.summary: When planning product development before you have product-market fit, continual iteration and getting comfortable with discomfort can help light the way.
items.content_html: When planning product development before you have product-market fit, continual iteration and getting comfortable with discomfort can help light the way.
items.content_text: When planning product development before you have product-market fit, continual iteration and getting comfortable with discomfort can help light the way.

items.title: A primer on product management for engineers
items.summary: Breaking down the basics and benefits for engineers looking to manage product development with precision and verve.

items.title: The great tightrope act
items.summary: By thoughtfully balancing ideas and inputs during the planning process, engineering managers can enrich team impacts and business outcomes.

items.content_text: By thoughtfully balancing ideas and inputs during the planning process, engineering managers can enrich team impacts and business outcomes.

items.title: Planning for change with RFCs
items.summary: How an enduring framework for knowledge-sharing and decision-making helped one team make more informed, egalitarian decisions—and how you can too.
items.content_html: How an enduring framework for knowledge-sharing and decision-making helped one team make more informed, egalitarian decisions—and how you can too.
items.content_text: How an enduring framework for knowledge-sharing and decision-making helped one team make more informed, egalitarian decisions—and how you can too.

items.title: Road to somewhere
items.summary: By sharing both the route and the destination to our strategic objectives, we can set ourselves up for a smooth planning journey.
items.content_html: By sharing both the route and the destination to our strategic objectives, we can set ourselves up for a smooth planning journey.
items.content_text: By sharing both the route and the destination to our strategic objectives, we can set ourselves up for a smooth planning journey.

items.title: Software development as a wicked problem
items.summary: An exploration of the foundational complexities of building software at scale—and why they often distill into human, rather than technical, challenges.
items.content_html: An exploration of the foundational complexities of building software at scale—and why they often distill into human, rather than technical, challenges.
items.content_text: An exploration of the foundational complexities of building software at scale—and why they often distill into human, rather than technical, challenges.

items.title: Tools for people
items.summary: Considering the complementary—but not all-encompassing—role tooling can play in the planning process.

items.content_text: Considering the complementary—but not all-encompassing—role tooling can play in the planning process.

items.title: Open-source excursions: The poetry of planning
items.summary: Reflections on the value of a planning process that emphasizes transparency, empathy, and the people behind the products.
items.content_html: Reflections on the value of a planning process that emphasizes transparency, empathy, and the people behind the products.
items.content_text: Reflections on the value of a planning process that emphasizes transparency, empathy, and the people behind the products.

items.title: Planning for pause
items.summary: As a companion to agile development practices, milestones offer a meditative—and productive—opportunity to decelerate.
items.content_html: As a companion to agile development practices, milestones offer a meditative—and productive—opportunity to decelerate.
items.content_text: As a companion to agile development practices, milestones offer a meditative—and productive—opportunity to decelerate.

items.title: How to make pathfinder soup
items.summary: Like the parable of stone soup, pathfinders can help development teams deliver complex and ambiguous projects, one ingredient at a time.
items.content_html: Like the parable of stone soup, pathfinders can help development teams deliver complex and ambiguous projects, one ingredient at a time.
items.content_text: Like the parable of stone soup, pathfinders can help development teams deliver complex and ambiguous projects, one ingredient at a time.

items.title: Just hire great people?
items.summary: Why enabling growing teams to flourish begins with an examination of our systems—and a well-considered hiring plan.
items.content_html: Why enabling growing teams to flourish begins with an examination of our systems—and a well-considered hiring plan.
items.content_text: Why enabling growing teams to flourish begins with an examination of our systems—and a well-considered hiring plan.

items.title: Planning for privacy
items.summary: A look at the proactive practices and perspectives that can help companies center privacy in product development.
items.content_html: A look at the proactive practices and perspectives that can help companies center privacy in product development.
items.content_text: A look at the proactive practices and perspectives that can help companies center privacy in product development.

items.title: On planning in public
items.summary: YouTrack’s Elena Pishkova shares how the team plans products in public view and in collaboration with customers.
items.content_html: YouTrack’s Elena Pishkova shares how the team plans products in public view and in collaboration with customers.
items.content_text: YouTrack’s Elena Pishkova shares how the team plans products in public view and in collaboration with customers.

items.title: What planning is like at…
items.summary: From sprint cadence to success metrics, here’s a snapshot of the planning process at Netflix, Mailchimp, Asana, LaunchDarkly, and more.
items.content_html: From sprint cadence to success metrics, here’s a snapshot of the planning process at Netflix, Mailchimp, Asana, LaunchDarkly, and more.

items.title: Planning with flare
items.summary: On thorny software projects, formal specifications can serve as beacons that illuminate the terrain ahead.
items.content_html: On thorny software projects, formal specifications can serve as beacons that illuminate the terrain ahead.
items.content_text: On thorny software projects, formal specifications can serve as beacons that illuminate the terrain ahead.

items.title: The best-laid plans
items.summary: Wherein a career in machine learning begins with a virtual turtle, an appetite for literature, and an economics degree…
items.content_html: Wherein a career in machine learning begins with a virtual turtle, an appetite for literature, and an economics degree…
